item.title: Wendolyn add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I don't want to repeat my innocence. I want the pleasure of losing it again." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Wendolyn add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "If there is no love in the world, we will make a new world, and we will give it walls, and we will furnish it with soft, red interiors, from the inside out, and give it a knocker that resonates like a diamond falling to a jeweller's felt so that we should never hear it. Love me, because love doesn't exist, and I have tried everything that does." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Wendolyn add a quote by Shirley Jackson
item.description: "On the moon we wore feathers in our hair, and rubies on our hands. On the moon we had gold spoons." -- Shirley Jackson

item.title: Wendolyn add a quote by Shirley Jackson
item.description: "A pretty sight, a lady with a book." -- Shirley Jackson

item.title: Wendolyn add a quote by Shirley Jackson
item.description: "I shall weave a suit of leaves. At once. With acorns for buttons." -- Shirley Jackson

item.title: Wendolyn add a quote by Saul Alinsky
item.description: "The human spirit glows from that small inner light of doubt whether we are right, while those who believe with certainty that they possess the right are dark inside and darken the world outside with cruelty, pain, and injustice." -- Saul Alinsky

item.title: Wendolyn add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "All men have stars, but they are not the same things for different people. For some, who are travelers, the stars are guides. For others they are no more than little lights in the sky. For others, who are scholars, they are problems... But all these stars are silent. You-You alone will have stars as no one else has them... In one of the stars I shall be living. In one of them I shall be laughing. And so it will be as if all the stars will be laughing when you look at the sky at night..You, only you, will have stars that can laugh! And when your sorrow is comforted (time soothes all sorrows) you will be content that you have known me... You will always be my friend. You will want to laugh with me. And you will sometimes open your window, so, for that pleasure... It will be as if, in place of the stars, I had given you a great number of little bells that knew how to laugh" -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Wendolyn add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice." -- Martin Luther King Jr.
